00015 #ifndef __MEZZO_UTIL__

00018 #include <set>
00019 #include <string>
00020 
00021 std::string fmt(const char *format, ...);
00022 
00023 // It is kind of silly to me that STL doesn't have a set_intesection function with
00024 // this signature.  To use set_intersection directly, you have to construct an
00025 // insert_iterator and do other stuff that isn't pretty.
00026 template<class T>
00027 std::set<T> SetIntersection(std::set<T> x, std::set<T> y)
00028 {
00029    std::set<T> out;
00030    std::insert_iterator<std::set<T> > out_iterator(out, out.begin());
00031    set_intersection(x.begin(), x.end(), y.begin(), y.end(), out_iterator);
00032    return out;
00033 }
00034 
00035 
00036 #endif
